text: hi! is there a way to remove span wrapper from flexible column children modules? ive tried adding custom wrapper html, but id only adds on top of existing structure. i dont think putting divs inside spans is proper html.
cc: <@U011U4A6TNY>

you can use the `no_wrapper` attribute on the flex column but I don't think you can on modules inside of it. You could easily add some JS to remove the extra wrappers but obviously that's a little hacky
yea, hacky js came to my mind already, but id like to avoid doing that :smile:
`$(element).unwrap()` boom done
lol
`no_wrapper` doesnt seem to do anything even for the main element, but to no surprise, as its not even mentioned in documentation for flex column
`no_wrapper=True`
yep, gives me exactly the same structure
oh, that's lame

Question for you all: if you had the ability to configure what options appear on the rich text toolbar in the page editor, would you use it? If so, what would you disable/remove from the rich text toolbar?
toggle off the rte :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
joking joking.
no jokes allowed!!! jk jk
:slightly_smiling_face:
I mean, for real though, you could maybe just turn off _everything_ in the rich text toolbar if you wanted
Color / Highlighting. Going deeper, being able to define the color picker options module/page/theme wide
i would shut off color, conversely. we have tightly branded clients that should not be choosing colors, should be allowing CSS to make the decisions
and is there an emoji insertion? i would make that removable for sure
yeah we have clients who complain that some of their team members abuse the emojis even after being asked not to use them
also yeah i would shut off fonts and font sizing. Again, if you’ve tightly branded your site, you do not want anyone “picking” a font, size, or color.
meaning: I would make those things something that an admin can turn on or off. I’m not saying they’re not super useful for other people’s clients.
I would make everyone write in markdown if I could :stuck_out_tongue:

But yeah probably disabling most of the color options. An option to define code snippets or shortcodes would also be cool? So there could just be a button to insert a styled button or a `blockquote` with special formatting for the citation
How would you all want to configure this stuff? At the module level? At the theme level? Somewhere else?
for us, probably at the theme level
theme from a branding level, but page or even dnd area for certain applications

YES! I’d be fine with any control. Can the Rt only allow certain tags? Today someone copy/pasted into hubDB rich text field and a ton of WordPress markup got inserted. I’d even love if the editor could strip out tags that are not allowed via copy paste

Any drag and drop/flexible column scenario will always wrap them for the page editor functionality. I do wish it was just there in the page editor and then removed from live pages, but I doubt this would be high on the Dev team’s priority list
